p: Progressive and relapsing disease were very aggressive; only seven (19%) of 36 patients received salvage therapy, with no responses, and with a median survival after relapse or progression from MARIETTA treatment of 1 month (IQR 1–3). Therefore, overall survival was similar to progression-free survival in each subset of patients analysed ( figure 2; appendix p 14). 33 patients were alive at last follow-up, with a 2-year overall survival of 46% (95% CI 39–53) for the total assessable population and 83% (82–84) for transplanted patients ( appendix p 14).
